alert.note: Alert for Clark (Missouri) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS QuadCities (Eastern Iowa and Northwestern Illinois - Quad Cities)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued August 05 at 9:49AM CDT until August 08 at 4:20PM CDT by NWS QuadCities
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 1130 AM CDT THIS MORNING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of northeast Missouri, including the following counties, Clark and Scotland. * WHEN...Until 1130 AM CDT. * IMPACTS...Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. Expect many areas of slow moving or standing water. It will take several hours for all the water from these storms to work through local drainage systems in urban areas. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 931 AM CDT, The rain has ended across the area. Clark County sheriff reports numerous road and culvert washouts on secondary roads across the county. Travel is discouraged across Clark County.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. In hilly terrain there are hundreds of low water crossings which are potentially dangerous in heavy rain. Do not attempt to cross flooded roads. Find an alternate route.
